intro: Xylopia niyomdhamii, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a member of the Anacardiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its pinnate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow or red when mature. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine and pharmacological research.
